rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses factual language ('reported', 'had been in contact'), lacking high-potency framing.
Contains scale ('one case') but uses a plain outcome verb ('reported').
Segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
Reports a single case (bare fact) but contains no explicit calming cue.
'Only one case' has a minimiser but lacks explicit scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Reports 'Only one case has been reported' which is factual reporting of a numerical metric using a standard verb.
